Step 4: Heat a lightly greased 6 inch skillet; remove from heat. Step 5: Spoon in 2 tbsp batter; lift and tilt skillet to spread evenly. Step 6: Return to heat; brown on one side only. Step 7: To remove, invert pan over paper toweling. Step 8: Repeat with remaining batter. Step 9: Delicious filled with any flavor fruit jam, sweetened fresh peaches, cream cheese and pineapple, ham or maple syrup.

prompt: How do I make Couscous with Currants and Cumin?
completion: Step 1: In saucepan, bring water to boil. Step 2: Stir in couscous and currants. Step 3: Cover and  remove from heat.  let stand 5 minutes. Step 4: Meanwhile, heat oil in large non-stick  fry pan over medium-high heat.  add onion, garlic and ginger. Step 5: Saute 3 minutes  or until tender. Step 6: Add cumin seeds. Step 7: Saute 1 minute. with fork, fluff couscous  and currants. Step 8: Stir in onion mixture, orange zest and coriander. Step 9: Add salt and  hot chili flakes to taste.

prompt: How do I make Lemonade?
completion: Step 1: Cut the lemons into dice.  put into a jug with the sugar. Step 2: Pour on boiling water and leave for 15 - 30 minutes until strong without becoming bitter. Step 3: Strain. Step 4: Put mint into the serving jug with  ice and slices of fresh lemon an hour before serving. Step 5: Makes 6-8 glasses

prompt: How do I make Quick Spanish Couscous Salad?
completion: Step 1: Stir olives, tomato, garlic, thyme and oregano into cooked couscous. Step 2: Serve  hot, warm or cold. Step 3: Makes 3 cups.

prompt: How do I make Curried Peanut Shrimp?
completion:
Step 1: Combine marmalade, orange juice, peanut butter, mustard, curry powder, vegetable oil, salt, peppers, and chili sauce in a blender. Step 2: Process until smooth. Step 3: Reserve 1/4 cup marinade. Step 4: Place remaining marinade mixture in a large zip-top plastic bag; add the shrimp. Step 5: Seal bag and shake to coat. Step 6: Marinate in refrigerator 30 minutes. Step 7: Prepare grill or broiler. Step 8: Remove shrimp from bag, reserving marinade. Step 9: Thread shrimp onto each of 4  (12-inch) skewers. Step 10: Place kebabs on a grill rack or broiler pan coated with cooking spray.", 
"cook 3 minutes on each side or until shrimp are done, basting  frequently with remaining marinade. Step 11: Spoon reserved 1/4 cup marinade over shrimp.

prompt: How do I make Dutch Split Pea Soup?
completion:
Step 1: Cut off and discard tough green tops, outer leaves, and root ends from the  leeks. Step 2: Split leeks lengthwise and rinse well; slice thinly and set aside. Step 3: In a 5 or 6 quart pan over medium-high heat, stir bacon often until brown. Step 4: Transfer  bacon with slotted spoon to paper towels, set aside. Step 5: Discard all but 2 tablespoons fat from pan. Step 6: Add leeks, celery, onion, and chopped parsley to the pan. Step 7: Stir often over medium heat until vegetables are limp, about 15 minutes. Step 8: Return bacon to pan with split peas, broth and 1 quart water.", 
"bring to a boil over high heat. Step 9: Cover and simmer until peas are mostly dissolved, about 1-1/2 hours; stir occasionally. Step 10: Add kielbasa. Step 11: Stir often until sausage is hot, about 10 minutes. Step 12: Notes : i sometimes use lean ham instead of bacon.

prompt: How do I make Macadamia Bars?
completion:
Step 1: Crusts: in food processor or bowl, combine flour and sugar. Step 2: Add  butter and process (or cut in with pastry blender) until mixture resembles  coarse crumbs. Step 3: Add water and vanilla; process or stir just until mixture  forms a ball. Step 4: On lightly floured surface, roll dough into a 13 by 8 inch  rectangle. press onto bottom and side of 15 1/2 by 10 1/2-inch jelly-roll pan. Step 5: Refrigerate for at least 30 minutes. Step 6: Preheat oven to 400°. bake dough for 10 minutes. Step 7: Cool on wire rack. Step 8: Reduce oven temperature to 350° for later use.", 
"filling: in heavy 3-quart saucepan, combine all filling ingredients except nuts. Step 9: Bring to a boil over medium-high heat, stirring constantly. Step 10: Pour filling evenly into crust and sprinkle nuts on top. Step 11: Bake on center oven rack 50 to 60 minutes,  rotating every 20 minutes, until top is a deep golden brown. Step 12: Cool on wire rack. Step 13: Cut into 2 x 1-inch bars.

prompt: How do I make 7-Up Cake?
completion: Step 1: Empty lemon supreme cake mix and instant pineapple pudding into a large mixing bowl. Step 2: Add oil and eggs. Step 3: Beat about 2 minutes. Step 4: Add 7-up and mix until well blended. Step 5: Pour into a greased and floured cake sheet pan. Step 6: Preheat oven to 350 degrees fahrenheit. Step 7: Bake 35 to minutes or until done. Step 8: While still hot spread with icing. Step 9: Icing: Step 10: Cook margarine, sugar, pineapple, flour and eggs until thick. Step 11: Add coconut and blend well. Step 12: Spread over cake while both are still warm.

prompt: How do I make Macadamia and Coconut Bars?
completion:
Step 1: Wet inside of a 13\" x 9\" pan; line with aluminum foil. butter the foil. Step 2: Place pan in freezer or refrigerator. Step 3: Beat butter until soft. Step 4: Add 1/2 cup of the brown sugar; beat until well-mixed. Step 5: Beat in 1 egg and 1/4 teaspoon salt. Step 6: Beating on low speed, add 1-1/4 cups flour and beat only until  incorporated. Step 7: Place mixture by very small spoonfuls all over bottom of cold pan. Step 8: With floured fingertips, carefully, patiently, and slowly spread the dough in an even layer all over bottom of pan, re-flouring fingertips often.", 
"bake at 350 degrees fahrenheit until set, about 15 minutes. Step 9: Remove pan from oven and let stand. Step 10: Do not turn off oven. Step 11: Shake nuts gently in a wide strainer to remove excess salt; set aside. Step 12: Sift together the 2 tablespoons flour, pinch salt and baking powder; set aside. Step 13: Beat remaining 2 eggs and remaining 1 cup brown sugar until thoroughly mixed. Step 14: Beat in sifted ingredients. Step 15: Gently stir in 1 -1/2 cup coconut (reserve remaining coconut) and nuts. Step 16: Place mixture by tablespoons evenly over top of bottom layer.", 
"with the bottom of a spoon spread into a smooth very thin layer. Step 17: Sprinkle with remaining 1 cup coconut. Step 18: Bake at 350 degrees fahrenheit, reversing pan front to back once during baking, until top is richly browned and toothpick inserted in middle comes out clean, about 25 minutes. Step 19: Cool. Step 20: Cover with a cookie sheet and turn upside down. Step 21: Remove pan and carefully peel off the foil. Step 22: Cover with wax paper and another cookie sheet or cutting board and turn upside down again, leaving cake right-side up.", 
"refrigerate for a few hours or more or place in freezer for about 1 hour. Step 23: Cut into 32 even bars. Step 24: Wrap each bar in either clear cellophane or wax  paper, or place bars in airtight container with wax paper between layers.

prompt: How do I make Super Scones?
completion:
Step 1: Combine flour, sugar, baking powder, baking soda, and salt thoroughly. Step 2: Cut in butter to make fine crumbs. Step 3: Stir in currants. Step 4: In small bowl, beat egg lightly; remove 1 tablespoon and combine with  cream. set aside. Step 5: Add buttermilk to remaining egg. Step 6: Add all at once to dry ingredients, stirring with a fork to make a soft, slightly sticky dough. Step 7: Gather into a ball and turn out onto a lightly floured surface. Step 8: Knead gently a few times until smooth. Step 9: Roll or pat to 1\" thickness.", 
"cut into 3.5\" or 2.5\" rounds. (don't twist!) Step 10: Place on ungreased baking sheet. Step 11: Brush tops with reserved egg mixture. Step 12: Bake in 425 degree fahrenheit oven for about 15 minutes or until golden and baked  through. Step 13: Serve fresh baked and warm if possible.

prompt: How do I make Ginger Biscuits?
completion: Step 1: Make into 8 biscuits and cook on top of the stove at low-med., approx. Step 2: 5 minutes  per side.

prompt: How do I make Mississippi Mud Pie II?
completion: Step 1: Preheat oven to 350 degrees fahrenheit. Step 2: Cook brownie mix as directed. Step 3: Spread jar of marshmallow cream over top while hot. Step 4: Cool. Step 5: Mix icing ingredients together. Step 6: Spread cooled cake with icing.

prompt: How do I make Mississippi Mud Cake?
completion: Step 1: Melt butter and cocoa together. Step 2: Stir in sugar and beaten eggs . Step 3: Mix well. Step 4: Add flour, salt chopped nuts and vanilla;  mix well. Step 5: Spoon batter into a greased 13x9x2 inch pan. Step 6: Bake at 350 degrees fahrenheit for 35 to 45 minutes. Step 7: Sprinkle marshmallows on top of warm cake. Step 8: Cover with chocolate frosting (your favorite).

prompt: How do I make Chicken Breasts in Phyllo?
completion:
Step 1: Preheat oven to 350 degrees fahrenheit. Step 2: In a skillet, melt 2 or 3 tablespoons of the butter; saute the onion until golden. remove onion and set aside. Step 3: Melt 2 or 3 tablespoons butter in the same skillet; saute the mushrooms until all juices are absorbed. Step 4: Add the onions, parsley and garlic and saute 1 minute. Step 5: Stir in the flour and blend well. Step 6: Add the vermouth or dry white wine. Step 7: Stir over medium heat until thickened. Step 8: Season with salt and pepper to taste. Step 9: Remove mushroom mixture from skillet and set aside.", 
"in same skillet melt remaining butter with olive oil and saute chicken until lightly browned, about 1 minute per side. Step 10: Remove from heat. Step 11: Brush one sheet of phyllo dough with melted butter and sprinkle with bread crumbs. Step 12: Place a second sheet of phyllo over the first; butter and sprinkle with bread crumbs. Step 13: Place a chicken breast in the lower half of the phyllo. Step 14: Put 1/4 of the mushroom mixture and 1/4 of the feta over the chicken. Step 15: Fold up the sides of the phyllo over the chicken, envelope style.", 
"repeat with remaining chicken breasts. Step 16: Place on a baking sheet, seam side down, and brush with butter. Step 17: Bake for 35 minutes, or until browned. Step 18: Notes : Step 19: Recipe may be prepared in advance up to the point the chicken is wrapped in phyllo then frozen. Step 20: To serve, bake frozen at 350 degrees fahrenheit for 50 minutes.

prompt: How do I make Curried Beef and Chicken Satay?
completion:
Step 1: Slice the meat into thin strips, no more than 1/4\" thick and about 1/2\" wide for  both the beef and chicken. Step 2: Combine the curry powder, chilies, garlic, onions,  salt, lemon juice, and honey in a large bowl. Step 3: Add the meat strips and toss well  to marinate for about fifteen minutes. Step 4: Thread meat strips onto bamboo skewers,  3 or 4 pieces per skewer. Step 5: Arrange the finished skewers in a glass casserole;  cover with the remaining marinade, and refrigerate while making the sauce.  brown under a broiler or grill the meat skewers.", 
"serve with a peanut butter  sauce for dipping (see below). sauce: blend all ingredients together well to  make a smooth sauce. keep refrigerated until needed, but warm before serving.

prompt: How do I make Baked Alaska Salmon Fillet With Mustard Sauce?
completion:
Step 1: Arrange salmon fillets in baking pan, drizzle with combined butter and oil. Step 2: Top with lemon slices. Step 3: Bake in 400 degree fahrenheit oven 15 minutes or until flesh is no longer translucent. Step 4: Mustard sauce: Step 5: Lightly saute shallots in butter; add wine and reduce until nearly evaporated. Step 6: Add cream; cook and stir until thickened. Step 7: Add mustard, chives, and parsley. Step 8: Season to  taste with salt. Step 9: To serve: Step 10: Ladle serving of sauce on serving plate; arrange lemon topped salmon on sauce.", 
"garnish with pear tomatoes and parsley sprigs.

prompt: How do I make Chicken Satay With Peanut Sauce?
completion:
Step 1: Preheat oven to 425 degrees fahrenheit (220 degrees celsius). Step 2: Spray baking pan with vegetable spray. Step 3: In a small bowl or food processor, combine peanut butter, chicken stock,  coriander, rice wine vinegar, honey, sesame oil, soya sauce, garlic, ginger and sesame  seeds. Step 4: Set 3 tablespoons (45 ml) aside. Step 5: Cut chicken into 1 inch (2.5 cm) cubes. Step 6: Thread onto 10 small bamboo or barbecue skewers. Step 7: Place skewers in prepared pan. Step 8: Brush with half of the  peanut sauce that has been set aside.", 
"bake approximately 5 minutes. Step 9: Turn over and brush with the remaining 1-1/2 tablespoons (20 ml) sauce. Step 10: Bake 5 more minutes or just until chicken is done. Step 11: Serve with remaining peanut sauce.

prompt: How do I make Yummy and Comforting Chicken Tetrazzini?
completion: Step 1: Cook the spaghetti according to package directions. Step 2: Saute the onion and green pepper in the butter. Step 3: Mix together all ingredients thoroughly in a large bowl. Step 4: Place in freezer containers, label and freeze. when thawed, bake, uncovered at 350 for 30-40 minutes or until hot and bubbly. Step 5: I like to add a little additional shredded cheese in the last few minutes of baking. Step 6: Place in containers and freeze

prompt: How do I make Garlicky Baked Chicken Marinade?
completion:
Step 1: In a medium bowl, mix together the mayonnaise, italian dressing, garlic powder, italian seasoning, and kitchen bouquet. Step 2: Place the chicken in the marinade. Step 3: Cover and marinate in the refrigerator for 20 minutes. Step 4: Preheat oven to 350 degrees fahrenheit. Step 5: Shake off the marinade from the chicken; discard excess marinade. Step 6: Place the chicken in a baking pan coated with non-stick spray. Step 7: Bake for 15 minutes or until the chicken is fork-tender and no pink remains. Step 8: Sprinkle with parsley before serving.", 
"note: this is great grilled or broiled too. Step 9: Libby's notes:  yes it really does cook this quickly--surprised even  me.   when i make it next i'm going to freeze the chicken in the  marinade. i  think  there's enough dressing to keep the mayonnaise from separating too  badly but  since the marinade is discarded anyway, it shouldn't  make much difference.

prompt: How do I make Apple or Crabapple Jelly?
completion:
Step 1: Wash 15 pounds of tart apples and quarter without peeling. Step 2: Place in a preserving   pan, just cover with cold water, and simmer gently until soft and tender. Step 3: Drain  through a jelly bag. Step 4: Shift the pulp gently occasionally to keep the juice  flowing; do not force the juice through as this will make the jelly cloudy. Step 5: Measure 32 fluid ounces of juice into a 12-quart pan and boil for 5 minutes. Step 6: Add  the sugar and boil for 5 to 8 minutes longer, or until a drop jells on a cold  plate. pour into hot clean jars and seal.", 
"continue cooking 32 fluid ounces at a  time until all the juice has been used. Step 7: Use the pulp for making an apple cheese. Step 8: Mint apple jelly: cook a few sprigs of fresh mint with the apples when  preparing to extract the juice. [1 or 2 drops of mint sauce may be  used if fresh mint is not available.]  add a few drops of green food colouring and mint sauce just before  pouring into the jars.  avoid adding too much flavouring and colouring. Step 9: Spiced apple jelly: tie a few whole cloves in a piece of muslin.  drop  into the juice at the beginning of cooking and only remove when jelly  is poured into the jars.

prompt: How do I make Apple and Marmalade Bread and Butter Pudding?
completion: Step 1: Place half the apples in a buttered shallow dish. Step 2: Spread marmalade on buttered bread; use half to cover the apples. Step 3: Sprinkle with half the raisins/sultanas and 2 tablespoons of the sugar. Step 4: Beat eggs and milk together; pour into dish. Step 5: Let stand for 40 minutes. Step 6: Sprinkle with cinnamon and remaining sugar. Step 7: Bake in preheated oven for about one hour or until well risen and golden brown. Step 8: Serve hot or cold with cream custard.

prompt: How do I make Coffee Frappe?
completion: Step 1: Place the ice, coffee, sugar and syrup in a blender. Step 2: Blend until the frappe  is smooth. Step 3: Pour into a large, tall glass. Step 4: Garnish with a dollop of whipped  cream.

prompt: How do I make Cafe Vienna Mix?
completion: Step 1: Stir instant coffee, sugar, dry milk powder and cinnamon together. Step 2: Process in a blender until powdered. Step 3: Use 2 teaspoons to one cup of hot water.

prompt: How do I make Habanero Honey?
completion: Step 1: Take a sterilized canning jar (i use 8 oz jelly jars) and fill half way up with honey. Step 2: Stuff as many pepper halves as you can into the jar, taking care not to trap air. Step 3: Fill the the rest of the jar with honey and put on lid tightly. don't worry about the seal, you'll be opening it again before you're done. Step 4: Vibrate the jar(s) to allow any trapped air to get to the top (i put my jars on top of the washer during the spin cycle). Step 5: Allow to sit for 2 or 3 days. Step 6: Open the jars to release any trapped air/outgassing from the peppers, reseal and store in a cool dry place.

prompt: How do I make Glowing Jell-O?
completion:
Step 1: Equipment: Step 2: 1 mold pan Step 3: 1 angel food or bundt cake pan Step 4: 1 clear glass plate Step 5: 1 small flashlight (i am also thinking you can buy one of those small safety flash red strobe-type lights for night use   the kind that uses the aaa batteries. i have a small one that i use on my bike that may be appropriate for this kind of dish) Step 6: Prepare the gelatin according to package directions and pour into mold or a big  plastic bowl. Step 7: Take a bundt cake pan or any angel food cake pan with a hollow  cylinder center where you can insert a small flashlight.  unmold the gelatin  onto the clear glass plate and place the plate atop the cake pan with the  flashlight underneath, standing up.", 
"turn out the lights!  for extra special  effect, you can put the blinking red strobe light under another small  transparent glass dish or plastic wrap and put that under the gelatin as well. Step 8: Some ideas: blue gelatin with red flashing strobe light lime gelatin with red flashing strobe light layered gelatin mold of red, green, and yellow gelatin with lights under it halloween flies last year there was a similar thread with lots of fun ideas. Step 9: One i remember was  inserting almond slivers into black raisins to make \"flies\", which you suspend  in orange jello.

prompt: How do I make Greek Stuffed Meatloaf?
completion:
Step 1: Preheat oven to 350 degrees fahrenheit. Step 2: Mix lamb and hamburger together. Step 3: Combine with eggs, milk, and oats. set aside. Step 4: Saute onion in oil over moderate-low or low heat for 20 to 30 minutes until translucent and golden. estimate the cooking time for the onions and approximately 3 to 4 minutes before the end of the cooking, add the garlic. Step 5: Combine meat mixture with onions, garlic, parsley, salt, cumin, and pepper. Step 6: In  a 9\" x 13\" baking dish, shape 2/3 of meat mixture into a hollow shell.", 
"combine spinach, egg, and feta cheese from filling ingredient list. pack this filling into the hollow cavity of the meat loaf. Step 7: Sprinkle with chopped olives. Step 8: Cover filling with remaining meat mixture. Step 9: Combine ketchup, cinnamon, parmesan cheese and tabasco sauce if using for the topping; spread over meatloaf. Step 10: Bake for 70 to 80 minutes.

prompt: How do I make Garlic Rosemary Chicken?
completion:
Step 1: Preheat oven to 450°f. Step 2: Remove the giblets, etc. and discard. Step 3: Loosen skin around chicken and stuff with rosemary and crushed garlic between the skin on breasts and drummys. Step 4: Lift the wingtips up and over back, and tuck under the chicken. Step 5: Place chicken breast side up, on broiler pan. Step 6: Cut thin slice from each end of onion. Step 7: Remove paper from garlic and chop tops. Step 8: Brush garlic and onions with olive oil and arrange around chicken. Step 9: Insert meat thermometer into meaty part of thigh.", 
"bake at 450°f for 30 minutes, reduce to 350°f and bake 1 hour and 15 minutes or until meat thermometer hits 180°f.

prompt: How do I make Spicy Hash Browns - Homemade?
completion: Step 1: Preheat oven to 400 degrees fahrenheit. Step 2: Combine olive oil, paprika, chili powder, salt, red peppers, and black pepper in a large bowl; stir well. Step 3: Add diced potatoes and stir well to coat. Step 4: Place potatoes in a single layer on a cookie sheet coated with cooking spray. Step 5: Bake at 400 degrees fahrenheit for 30 minutes or until browned.

prompt: How do I make Apple Pie Cake?
completion: Step 1: Cream butter, sugar and the egg. Step 2: Mix together the flour, baking powder, cinnamon, salt,  nutmeg, vanilla, apples, pecans, and raisins. Step 3: Mix together well with the creamed mixture. Step 4: Pour the batter into a round pie dish and bake at 350 30 to 40 minutes or until the cake is done and a toothpick inserted near the center comes out clean, not doughy.

prompt: How do I make Apple, Chicken and Mushroom Casserole?
completion: Step 1: Peel, core and dice apples. Step 2: Place chicken, onion and apple in a casserole dish with the mushroom soup mix, thyme, mustard and water. Step 3: Place a tight fitting lid on top. Step 4: Bake at 180 degrees celsius for 1 hour or until chicken is tender. Step 5: Stir in yogurt. Step 6: Clean mushrooms and cut in half. Step 7: Mix with chicken in casserole. Step 8: Bake for another 15 minutes. Step 9: Season with salt and pepper.

prompt: How do I make Apricot Basting Sauce?
completion: Step 1: Mix together sugar, apricot jam, salt, apricots, wine, honey and worcestershire sauce in a saucepan. Step 2: Mix together sugar, apricot jam, salt, apricots, wine, honey and worcestershire sauce in a saucepan. Step 3: Heat over medium heat until jam has been melted. Step 4: Heat over medium heat until jam has been melted. Step 5: Use sauce over chicken, pork, and lamb.

prompt: How do I make Apricot Muffins?
completion: Step 1: Combine apricot pieces and lemon juice. cream shortening and sugar, beat in egg  and stir in apricots. Step 2: Sift flour, baking powder, salt and nutmeg; add to first  mixture alternately with milk. Step 3: Add chopped nuts with last portion of flour. Step 4: Fill greased muffin tins two thirds full. Step 5: Sprinkle a little granulated sugar on top  of each muffin. Step 6: Bake about 20 minutes at 350 degrees f. Step 7: Makes 12 muffins.

prompt: How do I make Low-Fat Cool Cauliflower Salad?
completion: Step 1: Place cauliflower in a steamer basket over boiling water. Step 2: Cover pan and steam about 3 minutes, until almost tender. Step 3: Chill . Step 4: Combine onion, bell pepper, scallions, chives, and cooked basmati rice in a bowl. Step 5: Add chilled cauliflower. Step 6: Drizzle with dressing and serve chilled.

prompt: How do I make Copycat Coffee House Whipped Cappuccino?
completion: Step 1: Combine espresso, milk, sugar and pectin in a pitcher or covered container. Step 2: Stir or shake until sugar is dissolved. Step 3: Chill and serve cold. Step 4: Notes : Step 5: To make the \"mocha\" variety, add a pinch (1/16 teaspoon) of cocoa powder to the mixture before combining. Step 6: To fake espresso with a drip coffee maker and standard grind of coffee: Step 7: Use 1/3 cup ground coffee and 1 cup of water. Step 8: Brew once then run coffee through machine again, same grounds. Step 9: Makes about 1/2 cup fresh espresso to use in the above recipe.

prompt: How do I make Coquilles St. Jacques Duglere?
completion:
Step 1: First make the potato puree.  peel and boil potatoes, drain and dry them, then beat them to a puree with the milk and butter. Step 2: Put scallops in a pan with the sliced shallot or onion, salt, peppercorns, and bayleaf. Step 3: Pour on the water, add the lemon juice and poach gently for 5 minutes. Step 4: (do not let the scallops boil because this toughens them.) Step 5: Scald and skin the tomatoes, cut into four, remove seeds, cut flesh in four again. Step 6: Melt the butter in a pan, remove from heat, and stir in the flour.", 
"blend in the liquid strained from the scallops. Step 7: Stir over a gentle heat until liquid starts to thicken; add the creamy milk and bring to the boil. Step 8: Simmer for 2 or 3 minutes, taste for seasoning. Step 9: Add prepared tomatoes and parsley. Step 10: Slice or quarter the scallops and put into 4 to 6 buttered deep scallop shells; spoon the sauce over. Step 11: Pipe potato puree around each shell, sprinkle lightly with brown breadcrumbs and a few tiny shavings of extra butter. Step 12: If you prepare dish early in the day, put it in a hot oven 400 degrees fahrenheit for 10 to 15 minutes to heat through.", 
"if freshly cooked and scallops, potatoes and sauce are hot, put under the grill to glaze and brown the potatoes.

prompt: How do I make Corn and Potato Chowder?
completion:
Step 1: Cook bacon in heavy large saucepan over medium heat until fat is   rendered, about 3 minutes. Step 2: Add onion and cook until tender, stirring occasionally, for about 8 minutes. Step 3: Add potato and bell pepper and saute 1  minute. Step 4: Add 2 cups of milk and bring to a boil. Step 5: Reduce heat and simmer until vegetables are tender and soup thickens slightly, stirring occasionally, about 15 minutes. Step 6: Add creamed corn, fresh or frozen corn kernels, and 1 tablespoon thyme (or 1 teaspoon dried thyme) to soup.", 
"simmer until heated through. Step 7: Season to taste with   salt and pepper if soup is too thick, thin with additional milk.

prompt: How do I make Corn Chowder?
completion: Step 1: Dice  bacon, fry until crisp; drain and set aside, reserving 3 tablespoons of grease. Step 2: Stir diced potatoes,  diced onion, and celery into the grease. Step 3: Add water, salt and pepper to taste. Step 4: Cook until soft. Step 5: Then add can cream style corn and can of milk. Step 6: Heat to desired temperature. Step 7: Dish up into soup bowls and garnish with crumbled bacon.

prompt: How do I make Grilled Swordfish or Tuna Steaks?
completion: Step 1: Combine marinade and place in ziploc plastic bag. Step 2: Add fish, seal and refrigerate overnight, occasionally turning bag to distribute marinade. Step 3: Drain marinade. Step 4: Grill fish on a rack, about 4 to 5 minutes on each side over hot coals or briquettes (center will be a little pink ) or as desired. Step 5: Overcooking causes a dry fish.

prompt: How do I make Grilled Lamb with Lima Bean Skordalia?
completion:
Step 1: For lamb: puree first 6 ingredients in blender or processor. Step 2: Score large  muscles of lamb to form even thickness. Step 3: Rub yogurt mixture over lamb. Step 4: Transfer to shallow dish.  cover and chill overnight. Step 5: For skordalia: place beans in processor. Step 6: With machine running, add garlic through feed tube and chop. Step 7: Gradually add oil and puree, scraping down sides as needed. Step 8: Season to taste with lemon juice, salt and pepper. Step 9: Stir in parsley. Step 10: (can be made 4 hours ahead.  cover; let stand at room temperature.)", 
"prepare barbecue (medium-high heat) or preheat broiler. Step 11: Season lamb with salt and pepper. Step 12: Grill lamb about 10 minutes per side for medium-rare. let stand 5 minutes. Step 13: Cut lamb against grain into thin slices. Step 14: Serve lamb with skordalia and bread.

prompt: How do I make Grilled Grapefruit-Marinated Shrimp?
completion: Step 1: Submerge the zests of the grapefruit in olive oil and heat up to 160 degrees for five minutes. Step 2: Put oil and remaining ingredients in a shallow glass dish and  submerge shrimp in it. cover with plastic and refrigerate.  marinate shrimp for  at least 3 hours so flavors can penetrate.  remove shrimp from marinade and  place on a paper towel before grilling. Step 3: Grill for 1 1/2 minutes on each side  over hot coals. Step 4: Season with salt and pepper if desired.

prompt: How do I make Green Mango Salad With Cilantro Vinaigrette?
completion: Step 1: Peel, seed and grate mango. Step 2: In a medium bowl, combine mango, bean sprouts, and  grated carrot. Step 3: Mix remaining ingredients in a small bowl and combine with mango  mixture.

prompt: How do I make Greens and Apples?
completion: Step 1: In large saucepan, melt margarine over medium heat. add apples and cook,  stirring, until lightly browned. Step 2: Add remaining ingredients. Step 3: Cover and cook,  stirring occasionally, until greens are tender. Step 4: Serve immediately.

prompt: How do I make Corn Dog Casserole?
completion:
Step 1: In skillet, saute celery in butter for 5 min. Step 2: Add onions; saute 5 min. Step 3: Place in  a large bowl; set aside. cut hot dogs lengthwise into 1/4s, then cut into 1/3s. Step 4: In the same skillet, saute hot dogs for 5 min.  or until lightly browned; add to  vegetables.  set aside 1 cup. Step 5: In a large bowl, combine eggs, milk, sage and pepper. Step 6: Add the remaining hot dog  mixture. stir in corn bread mixes. Step 7: Add 1 1/2 cup cheese.  spread into a shallow 3 quart baking dish. Step 8: Top with reserved hot dog mixture  and remaining cheese. bake, uncovered, at 400 degrees for 30 min.  or until  golden brown.", 
"notes : i just use my own corn bread recipe.

prompt: How do I make Apricot Pound Cake?
completion: Step 1: Follow cake recipe on the back of the box except substitute apricot nectar for water. Step 2: Pour into a prepared (greased/flour) bundt cake pan. Step 3: Cook by directions on back of box for a bundt cake.  cool in pan. Step 4: Turn out onto platter. Step 5: Drizzle with lemon drizzle. lemon drizzle 1 cup powdered sugar juice of lemon mix until slightly thin, drizzle over cake

prompt: How do I make Ginger Layer Dessert?
completion: Step 1: Drain the cans of fruit, reserving the syrup. Step 2: Place one third of the gingernuts in a layer in the bottom of a 5 cup souffle dish and spoon over just enough of the syrup to moisten the biscuits. Step 3: Arrange one third of the fruit on top and cover with a layer of cream. Step 4: Repeat the layers twice and chill in the refrigerator. Step 5: Decorate with chocolate vermicelli before serving. Step 6: Cheers,  doreen doreen randal,  wanganui. Step 7: New zealand.

prompt: How do I make Gingerbread Yule Log?
completion:
Step 1: In a mixing bowl, beat yolks on high until thickened, about 3 minutes. Step 2: Beat in molasses and butter. in another bowl, beat whites until foamy; Step 3: Gradually add sugar, beating until soft peaks form. fold into yolk mixture. Step 4: Combine dry ingredients; gently fold into egg mixture until well mixed. Step 5: Line a greased 15x10x1 in. baking pan with waxed paper; grease and flour paper. Step 6: Spread batter into pan. bake at 375'f for 9-12 minutes or until cake springs back when lightly touched. Step 7: Turn onto a linen towel dusted with confectioners' sugar.", 
"peel off paper and roll cake up in towel, starting with short end. Step 8: Cool on a wire rack Step 9: Meanwhile, beat the first five filling ingredients in a mixing bowl until soft peaks form. Step 10: Unroll cake; spread with half the filling. roll up. Step 11: Spread remaining filling over cake. Step 12: Sprinkle with cinnamon if desired.

prompt: How do I make Grandma's Banana Ice Cream?
completion: Step 1: Beat eggs and sugar together. Step 2: Add next four ingredients to the ice cream maker and add enough homogenized milk to make 1 gallon liquid. Step 3: Freeze in maker or churn until frozen following manufacturer's instructions.

prompt: How do I make Slow-Cooker Grape Jelly Meatballs?
completion:
Step 1: Sauce: 13 ounce bottle heinz chili sauce 5 ounce jar grape jelly dash worcestershire sauce combine first 4 ingredients in large bowl and mix well. Step 2: Add enough breadcrumbs  to make meatballs the proper consistency; if the  mixture becomes too dry and  crumbly, add a little milk and  continue.  season with salt and pepper. Step 3: Form  into small  meatballs. Step 4: Brown meatballs, a few at a time, in a large skillet  over medium- high heat.  if meat is very lean, you may need to add a bit of oil  to  your skillet.  blend sauce ingredients and pour over meatballs.", 
"cover and  simmer about 30 minutes, stirring occasionally     or,  transfer meatballs to a  crock pot, and cook on low for several hours  until done. serve warm.

prompt: How do I make Gray Girls' Easy Chicken Fingers?
completion: Step 1: Cut chicken into strips. Step 2: Dip chicken in the salad dressing and then in the smashed crackers! Step 3: Bake for 15-20 minutes at 400f.

prompt: How do I make Greek Chicken and Cucumber Sauce?
completion:
Step 1: Combine marinade ingredients and pour over chicken. Step 2: Marinate in the fridge for up to 24 hours. Step 3: Remove chicken from marinade and grill over medium heat for 5 -7 minutes per side. Step 4: Serve with rice, or oven roasted potatoes, and cucumber sauce. Step 5: Makes 4 servings. Step 6: Tip: the marinade can also be used on strips of chicken. Step 7: After marinating, thread the strips onto skewers and grill for 5 - 7 minutes per side. Step 8: Cucumber sauce: Step 9: In a strainer mix cucumber and salt and set aside for at least 15 minutes.", 
"squeeze excess liquid from cucumber. Step 10: Blend grated cucumber with remaining sauce ingredients and refrigerate until needed. Step 11: Serve with greek chicken. Step 12: Tip: if you don't have a strainer put cucumber and salt in a double layer of paper coffee filters. Step 13: Gently squeeze the excess liquid out of the mixture.

prompt: How do I make Greek Mushroom Salad?
completion: Step 1: Heat the oil on low in a frying pan, then gently fry the mushrooms for 2-3 minutes. Step 2: Do not overcook. Step 3: Sprinkle in garlic and basil, then toss the mixture for a minute or two so that mushrooms are well coated. Step 4: Add the tomato, lemon juice, water, salt, and pepper. Step 5: Stir together and cook until the tomato softens. Step 6: Remove from heat and let cool. Step 7: Garnish with chopped herbs.

prompt: How do I make Greek Salad?
completion:
Step 1: Boil potatoes in skins for 30 minutes. Step 2: Drain, cool and cut into slices in a  bowl. Step 3: Add peppers, onions and parsley. Step 4: Fold in salad dressing and lightly  salt if wanted. Step 5: Should be about 3 cups salad ingredients needed 1 head of lettuce shredded, saving the good outer leaves 12 sprigs of watercress 2 tomatoes cut into 12 wedges 1 cucumber cut into 8 fingers 1 avocado cut into 8 wedges 4 portions of feta cheese, blocks are good for slicing into squares 1 green pepper cut into 8 rings 4 slices of cooked beets (bottled is fine) 4 jumbo cooked shrimp 4 anchovy fillets 12 greek olives 12 salonika peppers 4 radishes cut into rosettes 4 whole green onions line platter or large (this is a meal!) bowl with the outside of the lettuce  leaves.", 
"place the 3 cups of potato salad in a mound in the center of the  lettuce.  cover with the remaining shredded lettuce, mounding it up high. Step 6: Arrange the watercress on top. Step 7: Place the tomato wedges around the bottom  outer edge of the lettuce.  place the cucumber fingers in-between the  tomatoes standing upright on the lettuce.  put avocado around the same way so  you have tomato, cucumber, avocado repeating all round. Step 8: Place the 4 fetas  around  the top in a circle.  add the beets on the feta and the shrimp on the beet.   place the anchovy on top of the shrimp/beet/feta.", 
"place the olives, peppers,  green onions as desired. Step 9: This is a beautiful dish. Step 10: You will see the empty  spots to fill. Step 11: Dressing 1/4 cup white vinegar 1/4 cup olive oil  1/4 cup vegetable oil oregano   blend the two oils. Step 12: Sprinkle the entire salad with the vinegar then with the  blended oils. Step 13: Sprinkle oregano all over. Step 14: Serve immediately. Step 15: If you want to  make it early  in the day, wait until serving time to do the feta, beet, shrimp, anchovy. Step 16: The beet will stain the cheese.  we find it hard to destroy this work of art until we remember how wonderful  it is!! serve with toasted garlic bread for a meal.", 
"diane pyburn

prompt: How do I make Green Death Tuna Sandwich?
completion: Step 1: Mix first five ingredients together. Step 2: Toast whole grain bread. Step 3: Top two slices with cheese followed by the tuna salad. Step 4: Cover with remaining toasted bread. Step 5: Variation: green death tuna melt. fill two pieces of bread with cheese and tuna salad.  butter the outsides of the bread and cook as for grilled cheese sandwiches.

prompt: How do I make Baked Creamed Potatoes?
completion: Step 1: Peel and chop potatoes, cook in boiling salted water until tender, drain well. Step 2: Mash until smooth, mix with mayonnaise, sour cream, milk, lightly beaten eggs, mustard and parsley; season with salt and pepper. Step 3: Press mixture though a sieve, spoon mixture evenly into a greased casserole dish. Step 4: Sprinkle with grated cheeses. Step 5: Bake in a moderate oven 20 - 30 minutes or until golden on top.

prompt: How do I make Grilled Bourbon Salmon?
completion: Step 1: Combine juice, soy, brown sugar, bourbon, pepper, garlic powder and oil in a bowl. Step 2: Remove all skin from the salmon. Step 3: Place the salmon in a glass dish side by side. pour some of the marinade over (reserve some for basting while grilling). refrigerate for at least 1 hour a few hours will be even better. Step 4: Drain and grill over med.-high about 5-7 minutes per side or until fish flakes-basting with the reserved marinade.

prompt: How do I make Grilled Chicken & Veggie Pizza?
completion:
Step 1: Coat chicken with salad dressing and barbecue over medium heat for 5-7 minutes  per side. cool slightly and slice thinly. Step 2: Barbecue red pepper until skin is  blackened on all sides. Step 3: Put pepper in a plastic bag and close bag until pepper  is cool enough to handle. remove and discard skin, seeds and core. cut pepper  into strips. Step 4: Slice zucchini lengthwise and slice onion into thick slices. Step 5: Barbecue until softened. Step 6: Cut zucchini into bite size pieces. Step 7: Sprinkle 1 cup of  cheese over pizza crust and top with tomato slices.", 
"arrange chicken and  vegetables on top and sprinkle with remaining cheese and fresh basil. Step 8: Put pizza  on the barbecue, close the lid, and bake for 3 to 5 minutes or until the crust  is lightly browned and the cheese has melted. Step 9: Serves 2 to 4 people.

prompt: How do I make Grilled Bell Peppers?
completion:
Step 1: Take several bell peppers, cleaned of the stems and seeds.  cut into strips lengthwise.  these can be four to six depending  on the size of the peppers and your preference. Step 2: Season lightly with salt and freshly ground black pepper. Step 3: Brush both sides of the strips with good olive oil. Step 4: Place  skin side down on hot grill, until skin blisters and peppers soften   (3-8 minutes depending on grill). you can let the skin brown a bit if desired. Step 5: Turn peppers and grill until inner side is done (about half the time of  the skin side -- 2-4 minutes).", 
"try this with different color peppers.  maybe add a few green onions. Step 6: Try this with anaheim peppers --  very good! Step 7: Try adding sliced zucchini, too.

prompt: How do I make Grilled Pineapple and Bananas with Mango Sorbet?
completion:
Step 1: Cut pineapples in half lengthwise, leaving top with leaves attached if you wish  to serve it the pineapple shell. Step 2: Remove most of the pineapple from the halves,  in one piece if possible, using a paring knife and grapefruit knife.  cut the  pineapple inside piece in half lengthwise and cut out the core.  cut in half  lengthwise again and then cut each piece into 2. Step 3: (you should end up with about  8 long slices from each pineapple.) in a small bowl, combine brown sugar with  cinnamon and nutmeg.", 
"toss half this mixture with the pineapple. peel bananas  just before cooking, cut in half crosswise and lengthwise.   toss with remaining sugar. Step 4: Barbecue pineapple or broil until browned and partially cooked, about 8  to 10 minutes. Step 5: Cook bananas until browned, about 5 minutes. Step 6: Serve \"sticks\" of  pineapple and bananas in pineapple shells with a scoop  of sorbet.  note: if you are not serving it in the shells, buy the  pineapple already peeled and cored. Step 7: It can be cut into rounds or sticks.

prompt: How do I make Garlic Cauliflower?
completion: Step 1: Heat oil in a heavy nonstick skillet over medium high heat. Step 2: Saute next 4 ingredients 2-3 minutes, stirring frequently. Step 3: Add stock, cover skillet and cook another 3-4 minutes or until cauliflower is tender.

prompt: How do I make Garlic Greek Sauce?
completion: Step 1: Cut up the cucumber into very small pieces. sprinkle them with a little salt Step 2: And let them sit for a few minutes. this will draw out excess moisture. Step 3: Rinse them (but don't soak them) to get off the salt. crush the garlic and Step 4: Mix it with the yogurt. if you like your sauce thick, drain in through a Step 5: Cheese cloth and use only the thick stuff that remains. finally, mix in the Step 6: Cucumber. i like to add a lot of pepper and, at the last minute, a little Step 7: Lemon juice.

prompt: How do I make Garlic Pizza Crust?
completion:
Step 1: Dissolve yeast in water and add sugar. Step 2: Wait a few minutes. Step 3: Add oil  and salt  and garlic . Step 4: Mix in 3 cups flour and whip about 10 min till it leaves the  side of the mixer bowl. Step 5: Add remaining flour w/ dough hook or by hand. Step 6: Knead  till  smooth. Step 7: Allow to rise twice in the bowl. Step 8: Punch down. Step 9: (i rush this a bit) oil  baking sheets .use fingers press out to edges. Step 10: Makes 2 pizzas, cookie sheet size, let rise a bit and top. Step 11: Bake at  425*  20min.this is fantastic. Step 12: Crust smells slightly like garlic  bread.", 
"but is  notstrong. Step 13: We usually make one cheese and the  other with ground. Step 14: Beef, ham,  onion and mushroom. Step 15: Even the kids say it is the best crust so far. Step 16: This makes  2 cookie sheet sized or 12 after school snack size i  form them in thebottom of  a cheapo pie pan, top and bake  completely and put them in zip bags.

prompt: How do I make Baked Breakfast Potatoes?
completion: Step 1: In a large bowl combine all ingredients except the corn flakes. Step 2: Mix well and pour into a 9 x 13 inch casserole sprayed with non-stick cooking spray. Step 3: Sprinkle crushed corn flakes on top. Step 4: Bake at 350 degrees f or 45 to 60 minutes.

prompt: How do I make German Potato-Cheese Soup?
completion:
Step 1: Peel and prepare vegetables. Step 2: In a large cooking pot, add water, chicken broth,  chicken soup base, black pepper, carrots, potatoes, onions and bring to boil. Step 3: Reduce heat and simmer for 15 minutes or until vegetables are tender; stirring  occasionally. Step 4: Add celery, sweet red pepper and simmer for 5 minutes more.   gradually add mayonnaise to hot soup, whisking until smooth. Step 5: Reduce heat to  medium and add processed cheese, sharp cheddar cheese and swiss cheese and  simmer for 5 minutes or until cheese melts and soup is creamy; stirring  constantly.", 
"add instant mashed potatoes and stir well. Step 6: Let soup sit for 15 minutes before serving. Step 7: This soup is very rich, but good. Step 8: Refrigerate any unused portion. Step 9: Serves 12

prompt: How do I make Ginger Fried Chicken?
completion: Step 1: Add ginger, garlic, soy sauce, salt, and pepper to chicken, mix well, and  marinate overnight. add eggs to chicken. Step 2: Mix together well. Step 3: Add flour to coat. mix well. Step 4: Fry until  golden, about 5 minutes. Step 5: Finish in oven, 350 degrees for 30-35 minutes.

prompt: How do I make Gladys' Sweet Onion-Sausage Casserole?
completion: Step 1: Put onions in bottom of 12\" x 17\" pyrex dish. Step 2: Add ritz crackers, then sausage meat. Step 3: Add a layer of onions, cream of mushroom soup, salt, and seasoning salt. Step 4: Sprinkle layer of cheese and pimento. Step 5: Bake in preheated oven at 400f for 1 hour.

prompt: How do I make Golden Baked Fish?
completion: Step 1: Place fish in a greased 13-in x 9-in x 2 baking dish; sprinkle with pepper. Step 2: Beat egg white with salt if desired until stiff peaks form. Step 3: Fold in mayonnaise, dill and onion juice, spoon over fish. Step 4: Bake uncovered at 425 degrees for 15 to 20 minutes or until topping is puffed and golden and fish flakes easily with a fork. Step 5: Garnish with dill and lemon if desired.

prompt: How do I make Baked Crabmeat?
completion: Step 1: Using a nonstick skillet, coat with cooking spray and place over medium-high  heat until hot. Step 2: Add chopped pepper and celery and saute until tender; approx.  5  minutes. Step 3: Remove from heat and add parsley, mustard, ground pepper and hot sauce & stir well. Step 4: In a separate bowl, beat eggs lightly and combine with mayonnaise;  stir with wire whisk until smooth. Step 5: Add celery mixture and crabmeat; stirring  gently. Step 6: Divide into individual baking cups and place on baking sheet. bake at  375 degrees for 15 to 20 minutes.

prompt: How do I make Grape-Nuts Pie?
completion: Step 1: Combine grapenuts and warm water. Step 2: Let stand until water is absorbed. Step 3: Combine beaten eggs with all ingredients except pie shell. Step 4: Fold in grapenuts. Step 5: Spoon into pie shell. Step 6: Bake at 350 for 50 minutes.

prompt: How do I make Greek Lentil & Olive Salad?
completion: Step 1: In large bowl, whisk together oil, lemon juice, anchovy paste and pepper. Step 2: Stir in lentils, olives and oregano. Step 3: Cover and let stand for 1 hour. Step 4: (salad can be refrigerated in airtight container for up to 8 hours; let stand at room temperature for 30 minutes.) makes 2 cups (500 ml).

prompt: How do I make Greek Low-Fat Red Pepper Feta Dip?
completion: Step 1: Place peppers on greased grill over medium-high heat; close lid and cook, turning often, for 15 to 20 minutes or until charred. Step 2: Let cool; peel and seed. Step 3: In blender or food processor, puree together peppers, feta cheese, vinegar, sugar and cayenne. Step 4: (dip can be refrigerated in airtight container for up to 5 days; let stand at room temperature for 30 minutes.).

prompt: How do I make Greek Salad Dressing?
completion: Step 1: "place all ingredients in a jar, seal tightly and shake well."

prompt: How do I make Corn Dogs?
completion:
Step 1: Combine cornmeal, flour, baking powder, salt and egg; mix well. Step 2: Stir in milk to make a thick batter; place in a tall narrow glass. let stand 4 minutes to thicken. Step 3: Meanwhile, heat oil to 375 degrees f. Step 4: Pat hot dogs dry. dust with flour if desired. insert sticks in hot dogs; dip into batter. let excess drip off. Step 5: Fry until golden brown, about 5-6 minutes. (i've found it works best to fry them one at a time. unless you have a fryer that is big enough to handle more without them touching.).", 
"drain on paper towel.

prompt: How do I make Corn Fritters?
completion: Step 1: Mix the dry ingredients, gradually adding the milk and well beaten egg. Step 2: Beat thoroughly and then add the melted butter and corn. Step 3: Drop by spoonfuls into hot deep fat and fry until well browned. Step 4: Drain on brown paper.

prompt: How do I make Fresh Crab Cocktail?
completion: Step 1: Combine all ingredients by hand and chill thoroughly. Step 2: Crab cocktail  2 whole fresh dugeness crab, cleaned and cracked  shredded fresh icebury lettuce  2 fresh lemons, quartered  line a serving bowl with the shredded lettuce. arrange a cracked  crab attractively on top of lettuce and garnish with lemon quarters. Step 3: Serve cocktail sauce in separate bowl. Step 4: Serves 4  a  list for those seeking a lost favorite or family recipe

prompt: How do I make Bacon-Swiss Tossed Salad?
completion: Step 1: In a small bowl, combine mayonnaise, sugar, salt and pepper. Step 2: In a large salad bowl, layer a third of the greens and a third of the mayonnaise mixture, onion, peas and cheese. Step 3: Repeat the layers twice. Step 4: Cover and refrigerate for at least 2 hours. Step 5: Just before serving, add the bacon and toss.

prompt: How do I make Fried Cornbread?
completion: Step 1: Mix cornmeal and salt together in large mixing bowl. Step 2: Pour approximately 2 cups boiling water over dry ingredients. Step 3: Mix well. Step 4: After the mixture cools slightly, shape mixture into balls about the size of golfballs, one at a time.  you must wet your hands with water before you make each ball. Step 5: Flatten the ball with your fingers. Step 6: Fry in skillet (preferably cast iron) with about 1/2 inch of hot oil. Step 7: Fry until golden brown on both sides. Step 8: Delicious!

prompt: How do I make Fried Green Tomatoes?
completion: Step 1: Sprinkle sliced tomatoes with sugar, let stand about 15 minutes. Step 2: Combine flour, salt and pepper and coat tomato slices. Step 3: Melt 2 tbsp  butter in skillet. Step 4: Brown  tomatoes  slowly on both sides. Step 5: Remove each batch to oven proof platter and  keep in oven until all tomatoes are cooked. Step 6: Add more butter if needed. Step 7: For  crisp slices, serve as is. Step 8: Or add 1/2 cup light cream or dairy half and half to skillet. heat, stirring into drippings, and pour over tomatoes.

prompt: How do I make Fried Yellow Squash?
completion:
Step 1: Soak squash in buttermilk to cover, at least 5 minutes. Step 2: Mix dry ingredients together. Step 3: Dredge marinated squash in cornmeal mixture (i use a ziploc baggie & shake until covered). Step 4: Fry in  vegetable oil until golden, turn and fry until lightly golden on other side. Step 5: Salt lightly, remove from oil, & drain on paper towels. Step 6: This is delicious - also  works for fried green tomatoes (cut green tomatoes at least 1/4\" slices). Step 7: If you like fried okra - batter should be 1 cup milk + 1 egg.", 
"dredge in same mixture  as above & salt as you do for squash & drain on paper towels.

prompt: How do I make Frozen White Truffles?
completion: Step 1: Scoop ice cream into 6 balls; place onto a small cookie sheet or a 9\" pie pan. Step 2: Freeze until very firm. Step 3: Quickly roll firm ice cream balls in grated white  chocolate; press in gently. Step 4: Serve immediately or place on a foil lined cookie  sheet and freeze until serving time.  to serve, in some bowl, combine coffee and liqueur. Step 5: Divide coffee mixture into 6 small bowls. Step 6: Place 1 ice cream ball in  each dish.

prompt: How do I make Baked Apple Slices?
completion: Step 1: Cut apples into 8 or 12 slices each (like quarters). Step 2: Toss in bowl with sugar and cinnamon, then toss in the melted butter. put in baking dish and bake at 425 basting every 10 min until done. slices will be tender but will hold their shape.

prompt: How do I make Fruit Salad?
completion: Step 1: Dip chopped banana pieces in pineapple juice to keep them from turning too brown. Step 2: Drain and discard pineapple juice. Step 3: Mix  fruits, nuts, cream cheese and sugar in bowl. Step 4: Fold  in whipped topping. Step 5: Spread  in 9 x 13-inch pan. Step 6: Freeze  until firm.

prompt: How do I make Garam Masala?

prompt: How do I make Filet Mignon?
completion:
Step 1: We rarely eat beef but when we do for special occasions we enjoy the above for a most tender cut of beef. Step 2: Here is the way our family does it. there are other  methods of seasoning and roasting but we are always satisfied with the results  this way. Step 3: Try to buy a whole fillet that is already \"peeled \" ( trimmed of  silverskin, fat etc. ) or if you prefer you can buy untrimmed and do it  yourself. Step 4: The whole filet has a taped part ( called the tail ) and when you  roast, tuck this part under so you can have a more even  piece of meat for  roasting.", 
"if the whole filet is too large to fit your roasting pan you may cut  the filet in half and roast the two parts in the pan together. Step 5: Make sure the  meat comes to room temperature prior to roasting for even roasting which also  helps with tenderness. Step 6: Rub oil ( we prefer olive ) over the filet and then rub in seasonings such as salt , pepper, paprika, crushed garlic etc. the montreal  steak seasoning is a nice choice ( available in the seasoning or meat sections  of supermarkets ) . Step 7: Or other people prefer to coat the filet with dijon mustard  and then roll the filet in  finely crushed black or colored peppercorns prior to roasting.", 
"both ways are delicious. Step 8: Place the filet on a  roasting rack over the  roasting pan. Step 9: You can also place the filet over some beef bones in the pan which also act as a rack. Step 10: Preheat the oven to 475 degrees f. Step 11: Place the prepared filet on the rack and  roast 20 minutes ( for a average 5 lb roast- ). then decrease the temperature to 350f and roast an additional 20 minutes. Step 12: Remove the filet from the oven and let  sit about 15 minutes before slicing. Step 13: This total time factor  should produce  medium rare.  a heavier roast will probably need more roasting time and a  smaller roast less time. the sitting times allows for best slicing and lets some of the juices settle etc.    if you prefer you can  check and rely on a meat  thermometer to test so you don't under or over roast the meat..", 
"insert  thermometer in the thickest part of the roast. generally 120 to 130 f is rare  and 130 to 140 f is medium rare. remember the meat will continue to cook with  \"standing time\" out of the oven. Step 14: Meanwhile make the mushroom sauce ( this is a natural and not thickened sauce ). in a large skillet over medium high heat cook the onion in some olive oil or butter until softened. Step 15: Add the sliced mushrooms  and garlic and continue to cook and stir until the mushrooms have reduced in  volume by 1/2 and become tender.", 
"add the vermouth, dashes of worcestershire  sauce and gravy master (  a browning/ caramelized color for sauces etc. ). cook  and stir  another 5 to 10 minutes and then season to taste.   if you wish you   may add a few tablespoons of the pan drippings or a bit of beef bullion paste (  available in jars ) for a richer flavor. Step 16: The whole recipe really can serve  quite a lot depending on how thick or thin you slice the meat. leftovers reheat  well.

prompt: How do I make Dill Pickle Soup?

"simmer uncovered for 15 min. Step 7: Add the shredded port and cook 15 min more. knead together the softened butter, flour, and dill into a ball and add it to the simmering soup, stirring to blend. Step 10: Taste and adjust seasoning, remembering that salt tends to accentuate the sour taste. if soup is not tart enough, add lemon juice to taste. serve hot, with dollops of sour cream. "the author notes that using all beef stock makes the soup a bit too strong, and usually substitute half of the brown stock for chicken or veal.

completion: Step 1: Mix first 5 ingredients in saucepan. melt over low heat, stirring constantly. Step 2: Remove from heat and stir in cereal and pretzels. Step 3: Drop by rounded tablespoonful onto wax paper and allow to harden.

prompt: How do I make Crunchy Oven Fried Fish?
completion:
Step 1: Preheat oven to 450. Step 2: Cut fish into serving size pieces. Step 3: Mix flour, lemon  pepper, and 1/4 tsp salt in a shallow dish. Step 4: Beat egg white until frothy; place  in another shallow dish. Step 5: Combine bread crumbs, cornmeal, lemon peel, and basil  in a third shallow dish. Step 6: Dip top of fillets into flour  mixture; shake off any  excess. Step 7: Dip tops into egg white; coat with crumb mixture.  spray a shallow  baking pan with nonstick cooking spray. Step 8: Place fillets in pan, coating side up;  tuck under thin edges.", 
"bake for 6 to 12 minutes or until fish flakes easily  with a fork.

prompt: How do I make Crusty Garlic Bread?
completion:
Step 1: Preheat oven to 350°f. Step 2: In a small bowl, combine the garlic and oil, mix well. Step 3: In another bowl, combine parsley, thyme, marjoram and paprika. Step 4: Add parmesan; mix well. Step 5: Cut each loaf crosswise into diagonal slices, without cutting all the way through. Step 6: Brush cut sides of slices with garlic oil. Step 7: Sprinkle herb mixture between slices. Step 8: Wrap each loaf in foil, place on a baking sheet.  bake until heated through, about 10 to 15 minutes. Step 9: Unwrap the loaves and place them on a breadboard or in a basket.  serve immediately.", 
"freezer follow the recipe through step 2, but wrap each loaf in plastic wrap and then in foil. Step 10: Freeze up to 1 month. Step 11: To heat, preheat oven to 350°f. Step 12: Remove foil and plastic wrap from loaves; rewrap in foil. Step 13: Place on a baking sheet and bake until heated through, about 25 to 30 minutes.

prompt: How do I make Cream of Chicken Soup With Wild Rice?
completion:
Step 1: *i used superior touch chicken base and it was heavenly. Step 2: Cook wild rice according to package  directions for 30 minutes; drain off  liquid  and rinse thoroughly. Step 3: Set partially cooked rice aside.  in a large saucepan,  combine the chicken and water. Step 4: Bring to boiling,  reduce heat, and simmer for 40 minutes or until the chicken is tender. Step 5: Remove chicken from broth and let stand until cook enough to handle.  skim fat from broth. Step 6: Strain and reserve broth. Step 7: Remove chicken meat from bones.", 
"cut into bite-size pieces. Step 8: In the same  saucepan, cook celery and onion in hot oil for 4-5  minutes; add mushrooms and  cover and cook for 5 to 10 minutes or until  everything is tender, stirring now  and then. Step 9: Remove from heat.  return broth to the saucepan. Step 10: Add the partially  cooked wild rice to the chicken broth mixture. stir  in the bouillon granules  and white pepper. Step 11: Bring to boiling. Step 12: Reduce heat  and simmer, uncovered, for 15  minutes. Step 13: In a large separate saucepan, melt the butter.", 
"stir in flour until it  all clings together and is smooth. Step 14: Add the milk all at once and stir and  cook  until it's bubbly and thick. Step 15: Add some hot broth mixture to the white  sauce  mixture and stir until smooth; return all to the broth mixture.  stir in the  chicken pieces and the sherry. Step 16: Heat through.

prompt: How do I make Cream Puff Paste?
completion:
Step 1: Put water, butter or salt in a large heavy saucepan and bring to a boil. Step 2: Remove from heat (butter should be completely melted) and add the flour  all in one fell swoop. Step 3: Mix as quickly as possible with a sturdy wooden  spoon. Step 4: This mixture is known as a \"panade\". Step 5: Return the saucepan to the  stove over the lowest possible heat. continue to stir with the wooden  spoon while the panade dries out. this will take about 5 minutes, and a  thin crust will form on the bottom of the pan. Step 6: This is supposed to  happen, so don't worry about it, and don't try to scrape it up and  incorporate it into the dough, or you will have plaster chips in your  pastries.", 
"the dough should be soft, but when you pinch it between thumb  and forefinger it should not stick to your hand. Step 7: Dump the panade into a  bowl, and let it cool for at least 5 minutes. Step 8: Then add the eggs, one at a  time, beating well after each addition. Step 9: The mixture should be smooth and  creamy looking before you add the next egg. Step 10: After all 4 eggs have been  beaten in, the dough will be shiny and satiny yellow, thick and heavy. Step 11: Butter and flour a cookie sheet. fill a pastry bag with the dough.", 
"if you  don't have a pastry bag, you can use a tablespoon to drop dollops of  dough onto the cookie sheet for eclairs and/or cream puffs, but you  really must have a pastry bag in order to make a cream puff ring. Step 12: For cream puffs, squeeze out balls about the size of ping pong or golf  balls. Step 13: For eclairs, squeeze out oblongs at 3 to 4 inches long. Step 14: If you are using  the recipe given above, you should end up with 14 to 16 pastries. Step 15: Don't  succumb to the temptation to make fewer and larger ones, for they won't  cook properly if you do.", 
"brush the tops of the pastries with beaten egg,  using the bristles of the brush to gently push down and flatten out the  little curlicues left by the pastry bag as you lifted it off. Step 16: Finally,  drag the tines of a dinner fork down the length of each eclair. Step 17: The  resulting stripes will make for a more attractive and professional  looking product. for a cream puff ring, first mark a 10\" circle on the surface of the  buttered and floured cookie sheet. then, using a pastry gab, squeeze out  a 1\" wide \"halo\" of cream puff paste right on top of the circle you've  outlined.", 
"squeeze another 1\" wide ring of dough adjacent to - and  touching - the first. squeeze a third ring directly over the \"crack\"  between the other two. Step 18: Brush the whole thing with beaten egg, and  sprinkle a handful of thinly sliced almonds all over the top of the ring. Step 19: Let the cream puffs, eclairs, or cream puff ring sit and \"dry\" for no  less than 15 and no more than 25 minutes before baking. Step 20: The oven should  be preheated to 375f for cream puffs and/or eclairs, and to 400f for a  cream puff ring.", 
"bake the former at 375f for about 30 minutes, or until  they have puffed up nicely and turned golden brown. Step 21: Bake the latter at  400f for about 45 minutes, or until it is well puffed and golden brown. Step 22: Then, turn the oven off, open the door, and leave it halfway open for an  hour. Step 23: If it won't stay ajar by itself, prop it open by wedging something  in there. this is to allow steam to escape and to let the pastries cool  slowly and \"dry\" as they cool so that they won't collapse or become soft  and soggy.", 
"after an hour has passed, remove the pastries from the oven. Step 24: They are now ready to be filled. Step 25: To fill individual pastries: cut cream puffs and eclairs in half (from side to side, not from top to  bottom). fill with whatever filling you desire. replace lids. Step 26: Glaze with  icing or pour sauce on top. Step 27: Serve. it is wise not to fill pastries to far  in advance of the serving time. the closer the preparation time is to the  serving time, the smaller the likelihood that the pastries will begin to  soften or get soggy.", 
"to fill a cream ring:  use a slicing knife with a long serrated blade to cut the top off a cream  puff ring. Step 28: Fill the bottom with praline cream (or coffee cream, or  chocolate cream) filling. Step 29: Fill a pastry bag with sweetened whipped cream. Step 30: Use a nozzle with a zigzag edge (like pinking shears) to squeeze out a  layer of fancy puff-balls of whipped cream all over the layer of praline  cream filling. Step 31: Finally, replace the lid and dust the top with 10x  powdered confectioners' sugar. Step 32: Keep the cream puff ring in a cool dry  place until serving time.                  - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - -                     *  exported from  mastercook  *                            praline filling recipe by     : homemade good news (vol 3 no 3) serving size  : 1    preparation time :0:00 categories    : pastries amount  measure       ingredient -- preparation method --------  ------------  --------------------------------  1      cup           10x powdered confectioners' sugar    1/2  cup           almonds make the vanilla custard cream.", 
"place the sugar and nuts in a heavy saucepan and place over medium heat.  stir constantly with a wooden spoon. Step 33: It will take a while for the sugar  to melt because there is no water or other liquid in the pot. keep on  stirring! as soon as the sugar melts, it will turn into caramel. Step 34: Immediately remove from heat and pour the caramel onto an oiled marble  slab (if you have one) or onto an oiled cookie sheet (if you don't).  allow it to cool. Step 35: When the candy has cooled, it will be hard and brittle.  break it into pieces, place the pieces in your blender or food processor,  and grind them up into powder.", 
"fold the praline powder into the vanilla  custard cream. Step 36: - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - -  notes : this is for cream puff ring                    *  exported from  mastercook  *                            chocolate icing recipe by     : homemade good news (vol 3 no 3) serving size  : 1    preparation time :0:00 categories    : frostings, fillings, & icings amount  measure       ingredient -- preparation method --------  ------------  --------------------------------  3      ounces        bitter (unsweetened) chocolate  3      ounces        semi-sweet chocolate    3/4  cup           cream (heavy cream is best, but is so hard                       to come by that unless you have your own                       dairy you will probably have to use                       whipping cream)                       enough water to thin icing to desired                       consistency (1 or 2 tbsp) melt the chocolate in the cream over low heat, stirring with a wooden  spoon.", 
"bring to a boil. Step 37: Cool to lukewarm. Step 38: Add water as desired. Step 39: Spoon  over eclair or cream puffs. Step 40: - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - -  notes : this is a glaze for eclairs or sauce for cream puffs. Step 41: If you pour the icing while it is still hot, it will run off the surface  of the eclairs or cream puffs instead of sticking. Step 42: It should be warm when  you pour it. for a sweeter icing, increase the amount of semi-sweet chocolate and  decrease the amount of bitter chocolate. kim c.

prompt: How do I make Creamed Tuna?

prompt: How do I make Creamy Mushroom and Onion Rotini?

Step 5: Stir in cream, stock and wine.  when mixture boils, reduce heat and simmer for 1 minute. add hot drained pasta and toss. Step 6: Garnish with chopped fresh parsley and serve immediately.

prompt: How do I make Auntie Bettys Double Chocolate Cheesecake?
completion:
Step 1: Crust     roll out chocolate cream wafers on wax paper. Step 2: Mix crumbled wafers,  butter and nuts in the bottom of a 10\" spring form pan. Step 9: Stir in chocolate and vanilla. Step 10: Mix well.", 
"pour on top of  prepared crust and bake 50 minutes. Step 11: Remove from oven. Step 12: Turn oven off and close door. Step 13: Topping     combine sour cream, sugar and vanilla. Step 14: Spread over cheesecake.   return to oven, but do not reheat oven. Step 15: Leave in warm oven for 10 minutes with the door closed. prompt: How do I make Creme Brulee?
completion:
Step 1: Preheat oven to 300°f. Step 2: In top of double boiler over hot water, heat cream,  vanilla bean and sugar to almost boiling. Step 3: Lower heat and simmer for 1 minute.   remove from heat. beat eggs and egg yolks. Step 4: Pour cream mixture in a thin stream  into eggs, stirring constantly. Step 5: Return to double boiler. Step 6: Cook over medium  heat, stirring with a wooden spoon, for 3 to 4 minutes or until custard coats  back of spoon. Step 7: Remove vanilla bean. Step 8: Pour into 6 custard dishes or 4 to 5 cup  flame proof serving dish.", 
"set dishes in a large pan of hot water on middle rack of oven. Step 9: (hot water should be level with custard.)  bake for 35 to 45 minutes,  or until center of custard is set.  remove custard from water and cool. Step 10: Cover  and chill. Step 11: To serve, sift brown sugar on top of creme.  place dish into bowl of crushed ice.  leaving door open, place under broiler at least 6\" from flame  until hard crust of caramelized sugar is formed. Step 12: Serve immediately or chill  until serving time.  pass bowl of fresh raspberries along with creme for the  perfect topping.", 
"add a spoonful of whipped creme to the custard, if desired. Step 13: Variations, flavored creme brulee: Step 14: Vanilla bean: Step 15: Add 1 pod for 3 cups of cream. Step 16: Break it open lengthwise or simply pierce it, and put it into liquid before it boils. Step 17: Chocolate: Step 18: Add 4 1/2 oz cooking chocolate for each 3 cups of cream, melted in  warm liquid. Step 19: Praline: Step 20: Add 4 1/2oz pralines to each 3 cups of cream after it is cooked. Step 21: Nuts: Step 22: Add 1 cup finely chopped pecans or brazil nuts for 3 cups cream after it  is cooled.", 
"coffee: Step 23: Use 3 oz coffee beans (espresso, french roast, etc -- ) finely ground,  then grilled in a pan of 3 cups cream. Step 24: Add to boiling liquid; infuse for 15  minutes, then strain. Step 25: Bananas: Step 26: Mash 2 soft bananas; saute in 1 tbsp butter. Step 27: Add 2 tbsp brandy and 2  tsp brown sugar. Step 28: Cook for 5 minutes. Step 29: Pat down on bottom of creme brulee pan  before adding liquid. Step 30: Notes : Step 31: Use a double boiler to scald the cream unless you have a heavy  saucepan.   use very low heat.  milk scorches easily and, when scorched, should  be thrown out.", 
"beat eggs or egg yolks with a wire whisk or beater.   add sugar gradually and continue whipping until it is thoroughly mixed inches. Step 32: Never add eggs directly to a hot mixture. (unless you like scrambled eggs in cream.)  pour some of the hot liquid into the eggs while stirring briskly, then  return the warmed combination to the remaining hot liquid in the pan. Step 33: Stir the custard constantly over low heat until it acquires body.   test it  by letting it run off the back of a spoon; if a light coating clings to the  spoon, the custard is finished.", 
"stir the custard occasionally as it cools to prevent a surface skin from  forming.   when it is cool, chill it, covered lightly with a clean dish towel, in the refrigerator.

prompt: How do I make Green and Gold Chowder?
completion:
Step 1: Arrange fish in a shallow dish in a single layer. Step 2: Add half the milk and bay leaf, cover and cook on high for 7 minutes, until it can be flaked. Step 3: Reserve cooking liquid. Step 4: Flake fish, discarding skin and bones. Step 5: Cut the beans into 2 1/2 cm pieces and the baby corn in half if large. place the butter in a microwave safe bowl cover and microwave on high until melted. Step 6: Stir in the flour and whisk in the fish cooking liquid and the remaining milk, a little at a time, until mixture is smooth.", 
"mix the vegetables into the sauce.  cover and cook on high for 6 1/2 minutes, stir in fish and pepper to taste and cook for a further 2 minutes, until vegetables are cooked, stirring twice.

prompt: How do I make Tortilla Peach Cobbler?
completion:
Step 1: Preheat oven to 400 and lightly spray an 8 or 9\" round cake pan. Step 2: In a mixing bowl, stir together sugar and cornstarch. Step 3: Add peaches with juice and ginger. Step 4: Toss to combine evenly. Step 5: Spread 1/2 of the peach mixture evenly into prepared pan. Step 6: Arrange 1/2 of the tortilla strip over peaches. Step 7: Top with remaining peach mixture.  arrange remaining tortilla strips over peaches in a lattice pattern. Step 8: Lightly spray lattice with cooking spray and sprinkle with sugar and almonds, if desired.", 
"bake 25 minutes until filling is bubbly throughout and top is browned.

prompt: How do I make Tricolor Crustless "Quiche"?
completion:
Step 1: Preheat oven to 375 degrees f (190 c). Step 2: For frozen spinach:  cook over low heat until liquid evaporates.  fresh spinach:  wash and boil only in water clinging to the leaves until tender.  drain, chop, and place in bowl. Step 3: In a separate bowl, mash the cooked carrots. Step 4: In another bowl, mash the cooked potatoes. Step 5: In yet another bowl, mix the cheeses, flour, milk, eggs, white pepper, paprika, salt, and pepper. Step 6: Divide into 3 equal portions and place a portion into each of the other bowls of spinach, carrot, and potatoes.", 
"mix contents of all three bowls well. Step 7: Butter a deep 14x4-inch pan. Step 8: Spoon in potato mixture and bake in 375 degrees f (190 c) for 8 minutes. Step 9: Spoon in the carrot mixture and bake 8 more minutes. Step 10: Now spoon in the spinach mixture and bake 45 minutes or until everything sets. Step 11: Turn off the oven, but leave the quiche in the oven for 5 minutes. Step 12: Remove from oven, then let cool for at least 5 minutes before serving.

prompt: How do I make Twice Baked Potatoes II?
completion: Step 1: Bake potatoes until almost done. remove from oven and let cool long enough so that you can handle them. Step 2: Cut them in half lengthwise and scoop out the insides and place in a bowl. Step 3: Mash the potatoes with a masher, add some milk (for 6 potatoes i add about 3-4 tbsp.) and about 2 tablespoons of margarine. Step 4: Mash some more to mix in the milk and margarine. add about 1/2 cup of grated cheddar cheese , how much depends on how cheesy you want them, and mix the cheese in thoroughly. Step 5: Place the potato mixture back into the skins and bake at 350% for about 30 minutes.

prompt: How do I make No Bake Chocolate Cookies?
completion: Step 1: Simmer sugar, milk, butter, cocoa and salt over a low heat until well blended, then add rolled oats, chopped nuts, coconuts and vanilla and remove from heat. Step 2: Beat mixture well until stiff, then drop in spoon-fuls onto greased baking sheet. Step 3: Leave until set.

prompt: How do I make Unusual Chicken?
completion: Step 1: Mix together and marinate chicken for about 5 to 6 hours or overnight in a covered dish in the refrigerator. Step 2: Add one beaten egg and corn flour to cover. place some ground nut oil in a wok heat oil and deep fry on a low heat. the meat is now ready to eat. Step 3: If a hotter dish is required: take some curry leaves, ginger, garlic, green chilies, spring onions, coriander leaves. place all the above in a wok with hot oil and fry for a couple of minutes. Step 4: Add some yogurt and tomato sauce and stir. now add the chicken and some red food coloring and stir fry again to cover all the meat with the sauce.

prompt: How do I make Vegetarian Baked Stuffed Red Bell Peppers?

prompt: How do I make Chili With Biscuits?

prompt: How do I make Vidalia Onion Casserole?
completion: Step 1: Preheat oven to 350f. Step 2: Cut onions in quarters and slice very thin. Step 3: Set aside.     melt 1/4 cup butter in saucepan and pour over stuffing. prompt: How do I make Lemon Whipped Cream?
completion: Step 1: Whip heavy cream. Step 2: Fold in sugar, lemon juice and zest.

prompt: How do I make Whole Grain Buttermilk Pancakes?
completion: Step 1: In a medium size bowl, combine the whole wheat flour, oat bran, cornmeal, sugar, baking powder and baking soda, and salt.  in another bowl, combine the  buttermilk, egg yolks and oil. Step 2: In a large bowl, beat the egg whites until stiff  peaks form. Step 3: Stir in the buttermilk mixture into the flour mixture.  fold in the egg whites. Step 4: Lightly coat a skillet with cooking spray and set over moderate  heat.  when the skillet is hot, cook the pancakes 4 at a time, using 1/4 cup  batter for each. Step 5: Cook for about 2 minutes on one side or until bubbles appear  on the surface; turn, then cook 2 minutes or until golden brown on each side and cook through.

prompt: How do I make Yolkless Noodles?
completion:
Step 1: In a large mixing bowl stir together the 2 cups flour and salt.  make a well in  the center of the dry mixture.  in a small mixing bowl combine egg white, water, and oil. Step 2: Add to the dry mixture.  mix well. Step 3: Sprinkle kneading surface with 1  tbsp of the remaining flour. Step 4: Turn dough out onto floured surface.  knead till  dough is smooth and elastic (8 to 10 minutes total), adding 1 to 2 tbsp  additional flour as needed. Step 5: Cover and let the dough rest for 10 minutes. Step 6: Divide dough into 4 equal portions.", 
"on a lightly floured surface, roll each  portion into a 12\" square, (about 1/16\" thick).  let stand, uncovered, about 20  minutes. Step 7: Loosely roll up dough jelly-roll style; cut into 1/4\" wide strips. Step 8: Shake the strands to separate and cut into 2 to 3\" lengths. Step 9: If using a pasta  machine, pass each portion through machine according to manufacturer's  directions till dough is 1/16\" thick. Step 10: Cut into 1/4\" wide strips. Step 11: Cut strips  into 2 to 3\" lengths. Step 12: To store cut noodles, spread them on a wire cooling rack.", 
"let noodles dry overnight or till completely dry; place in an airtight container and refrigerate for up to 3 days. Step 13: Or, dry the noodles for at least 1 hour and  seal in  a freezer bag or freezer container; freeze up to 8 months. Step 14: Cook  noodles for 1 1/2 to 2 minutes or till tender but still firm, allowing a few  more minutes for dried or frozen noodles. Step 15: Drain noodles well.

prompt: How do I make Yorkshire Pudding Popovers?
completion:
Step 1: Preheat the oven to hot (425f/220c/gas 7) Step 2: Put a teaspoonful of oil or  dripping in each of several muffin tins or, to be truly yorkshire, a couple of  tablespoonsful in a larger roasting tin and place in the oven until the fat is  really hot and beginning to smoke.  meanwhile combine the rest of the  ingredients and beat to form a batter of the consistency of double cream. Step 3: If  you wish you can add mixed dried herbs to add a savoury flavour. Step 4: When the fat  is smoking take the tin out of the oven and place it over a low light so that it doesn't cool as you add the batter.", 
"pour in the batter if you're using muffin  tins don't over fill. Step 5: Remember that the puddings will rise and puff up. Step 6: Put  the tin back into the top of the oven as soon as possible and leave for about  20-25 minutes by which time they will be puffed up and crisp. Step 7: When my  grandmother used to make yorkshire pudding to go with the sunday  roast we would eat it in the true yorkshire way. Step 8: That is, as a first course with just a  savoury gravy poured over it.  after all, the idea of yorkshire pudding is to  fill you up so that you don't want so much of the more expensive meat!  if there was any of the pudding left over as a treat we  kids would have it as a desert  with golden syrup poured over it. servings: 4 ian rice (yorkshireman)

prompt: How do I make Zesty Fried Chicken?

prompt: How do I make Zucchini Lasagna (Lasagne) - Low Carb?

prompt: How do I make Zucchini Squash With Parmesan?

prompt: How do I make Tofu Lasagna?

prompt: How do I make Tom's Double Barrel Habanero Hot Sauces?
completion:

Step 4: Place the chilies, vinegar and lime juice in a blender and blend until peppers are finely minced. Step 5: Add the onion, garlic and carrots and  puree the mixture until smooth. Step 6: Return the mixture to the stove and simmer for 5 minutes. Step 7: Strain the mixture into an empty hot sauce bottle.  you'll get about 4  ounces. "place the  ingredients that were strained out into a jar and refrigerate. Step 9: It  will have  the consistency of finely grated horseradish and the flavor of  habanero fruit. Step 10: I love this on just about everything.

prompt: How do I make Tortilla Beef?
